alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 3:50AM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. The greatest winter weather concern in these counties near the Nebraska/Kansas border will be freezing rain this morning into early this afternoon. Ice accumulations around to possibly over one quarter inch will be possible. Freezing rain will change to snow Wednesday afternoon or evening before ending. Snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches are expected. Winds will average 15 to 25 MPH with highest gusts of 30 to 35 MPH, initially out of the northeast but then turning northwesterly tonight. * WHERE...In Kansas, Smith and Jewell Counties. In Nebraska, Thayer, Fillmore, and Nuckolls Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...The freezing rain may result in downed trees and power lines along with the possibility for power outages. Travel could also be very difficult in the warned area due to the combination of freezing rain and snow. The hazardous conditions will worsen through the day on Wednesday with lingering impacts into at least Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Slight changes in the storm track could greatly impact snowfall and ice accumulations today across these areas, which are right along the southern edge of this storm system.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
